channel.title: Washing Machine
channel.description: Well my mom decided to wash this comforter that was way too big for the washing machine we have, don't ask me why. It's obviously fucked up now, seeing that there's a giant pool of water on the floor everytime I have to use the machine. I'm not going to mess around with the machine to find out what's wrong since I have no experience when it comes to problems like this. Any suggestions as to what the problem is?

item.title: Washing Machine
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

skiller noob1:

Umm, then you fucking complain! It’s not yours you don’t have to pay.

You do if you broke it.

item.title: Washing Machine
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

[quote=“Gotta Catch Them All, post:6, topic:222660”][quote author=Chimaera God link=topic=292447.msg2356083#msg2356083 date=1217306651]

Have you tried rebooting it?

You can’t reboot a washing machine…
[/quote]

I just lol’d!!

I think you’d be better off just buying a new one rather than messing about with the one you have. Unless you have some knowledge of washing machines, it would most probably be a waste of time opening it up and having a look.[/quote]

I have no way near enough to get a new washing machine. It’s not even mine. The house I’m living in is a lease so everything still belongs to the owner lmao.

Read full topic

item.title: Washing Machine
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“Chimaera God, post:4, topic:222660”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=292447.msg2355461#msg2355461 date=1217287567]
Have you tried rebooting it?
[/quote]

You can’t reboot a washing machine…[/quote]

I just lol’d!!

I think you’d be better off just buying a new one rather than messing about with the one you have. Unless you have some knowledge of washing machines, it would most probably be a waste of time opening it up and having a look.

Read full topic

item.title: Washing Machine
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

I’ve sold washing machines and know a bit about them. I’m no expert but the idea that stands out to me is that the comforter was too big, and soaked up a lot of water and weight. The springs are probably getting old, and the extra weight caused the springs to overstretch, and smash the big piece of concrete in the washer around.

If it’s a top loader disregard what I said.

Read full topic

item.title: Washing Machine
item.dc:creator: @Gromit Gromit
item.description:
@Gromit wrote:

I would guess that it’s soaked up a hell of a lot of water making it too heavy for the mountings on the drum making it bounce around breaking the seals and water connections. Generally, its fucked so you may want to start looking for a new one

Read full topic
